title: No Logon information on Tab Names
author: bryan292
body_snippet: When leaving blank the credentials on the session and using the ones on options, is not showing the login information on the Tab Name

iterations.description: PuTTY/SSH connections overwrite the tab title with the terminal window title, removing the logon information suffix. The fix is to re-append this information in PuttyBase if the option is enabled.

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet:
Currently we just take whatever is in the Username field of the connection record. This doesn't work when using the `Connect (without credentials)` option, as you have found. We can fix this for some protocols, but maybe not all of them.

For RDP:
The `OnUserNameAcquired` event fires when the RDP connection receives a username. It provides the login user information as `domain\username`. We can use this to update the tab name even when using the `Connect (without credentials)` option.

notes:
AI triage (gemini): PuTTY/SSH connections overwrite the tab title with the terminal window title, removing the logon information suffix. The fix is to re-append this information in PuttyBase if the option is enabled.
Approach: Modify PuttyBase.ResolveTabText to check Properties.OptionsTabsPanelsPage.Default.ShowLogonInfoOnTabs and append the configured username/domain to the resolved terminal title, ensuring consistency with ConnectionWindow behavior.
